class.name: StreamPeer
class.brief_description: Abstraction and base class for stream-based protocols.
class.description: StreamPeer is an abstraction and base class for stream-based protocols (such as TCP). It provides an API for sending and receiving data through streams as raw data or strings.

method.name: get_16
method.description: Gets a signed 16-bit value from the stream.

method.name: get_32
method.description: Gets a signed 32-bit value from the stream.

method.name: get_64
method.description: Gets a signed 64-bit value from the stream.

method.name: get_8
method.description: Gets a signed byte from the stream.

method.name: get_available_bytes
method.description: Returns the amount of bytes this [StreamPeer] has available.

method.name: get_data
method.description: Returns a chunk data with the received bytes. The amount of bytes to be received can be requested in the [code]bytes[/code] argument. If not enough bytes are available, the function will block until the desired amount is received. This function returns two values, an [enum @GlobalScope.Error] code and a data array.

method.name: get_double
method.description: Gets a double-precision float from the stream.

method.name: get_float
method.description: Gets a single-precision float from the stream.

method.name: get_partial_data
method.description: Returns a chunk data with the received bytes. The amount of bytes to be received can be requested in the "bytes" argument. If not enough bytes are available, the function will return how many were actually received. This function returns two values, an [enum @GlobalScope.Error] code, and a data array.

method.name: get_string
method.description: Gets an ASCII string with byte-length [code]bytes[/code] from the stream. If [code]bytes[/code] is negative (default) the length will be read from the stream using the reverse process of [method put_string].

method.name: get_u16
method.description: Gets an unsigned 16-bit value from the stream.

method.name: get_u32
method.description: Gets an unsigned 32-bit value from the stream.

method.name: get_u64
method.description: Gets an unsigned 64-bit value from the stream.

method.name: get_u8
method.description: Gets an unsigned byte from the stream.

method.name: get_utf8_string
method.description: Gets an UTF-8 string with byte-length [code]bytes[/code] from the stream (this decodes the string sent as UTF-8). If [code]bytes[/code] is negative (default) the length will be read from the stream using the reverse process of [method put_utf8_string].

method.name: get_var
method.description: Gets a Variant from the stream. If [code]allow_objects[/code] is [code]true[/code], decoding objects is allowed. [b]Warning:[/b] Deserialized objects can contain code which gets executed. Do not use this option if the serialized object comes from untrusted sources to avoid potential security threats such as remote code execution.

method.name: put_16
method.description: Puts a signed 16-bit value into the stream.

method.name: put_32
method.description: Puts a signed 32-bit value into the stream.

method.name: put_64
method.description: Puts a signed 64-bit value into the stream.

method.name: put_8
method.description: Puts a signed byte into the stream.

method.name: put_data
method.description: Sends a chunk of data through the connection, blocking if necessary until the data is done sending. This function returns an [enum @GlobalScope.Error] code.

method.name: put_double
method.description: Puts a double-precision float into the stream.

method.name: put_float
method.description: Puts a single-precision float into the stream.

method.name: put_partial_data
method.description: Sends a chunk of data through the connection. If all the data could not be sent at once, only part of it will. This function returns two values, an [enum @GlobalScope.Error] code and an integer, describing how much data was actually sent.

method.name: put_string
method.description: Puts a zero-terminated ASCII string into the stream prepended by a 32-bit unsigned integer representing its size. [b]Note:[/b] To put an ASCII string without prepending its size, you can use [method put_data]: [codeblock] put_data("Hello world".to_ascii()) [/codeblock]

method.name: put_u16
method.description: Puts an unsigned 16-bit value into the stream.

method.name: put_u32
method.description: Puts an unsigned 32-bit value into the stream.

method.name: put_u64
method.description: Puts an unsigned 64-bit value into the stream.

method.name: put_u8
method.description: Puts an unsigned byte into the stream.

method.name: put_utf8_string
method.description: Puts a zero-terminated UTF-8 string into the stream prepended by a 32 bits unsigned integer representing its size. [b]Note:[/b] To put an UTF-8 string without prepending its size, you can use [method put_data]: [codeblock] put_data("Hello world".to_utf8()) [/codeblock]

method.name: put_var
method.description: Puts a Variant into the stream. If [code]full_objects[/code] is [code]true[/code] encoding objects is allowed (and can potentially include code).

members.member: If [code]true[/code], this [StreamPeer] will using big-endian format for encoding and decoding.
